title: Here is another XSS i got for you

profile.name: MoneyStream
profile.about: MoneyStream is dedicated to making your financial tasks easier.

vulnerability_information:
I ve verified it and it does trigger a JS alert
POST /blog/ HTTP/1.1
Host: moneystream.com
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; Trident/5.0)
Connection: close
Referer: https://moneystream.com/blog/
Cookie: TrackingId=d86722a7-b3fc-45a4-87c8-fac0a31cca27
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 30

s=Search%2bthis%2bwebsite%252671879%3balert(1)%2f%2f593

activities.message: Hi ht_shahmeer, Thanks for the reports on this issue.  We have still be unable to trigger a js alert even with the example you provided.  Would it be possible to provide a screen shot of the url you are using with the alert popped.  Simply using the url you provided does not pop an alert for us.  The url I am using is: https://moneystream.com/blog/?s=Search%2bthis%2bwebsite%252671879%3balert(1)%2f%2f593

activities.message: Use IE to get this popup

Hi ht_shahmeer, We have continued to try to test this and for whatever reason we aren't able to dup this to do a fix.  We have tried IE9 on a Win 7 machine and still it doesn't pop.  Could you provide a screen shot with the alert and the url bar in view so I can make sure we are using the exact url.  Also which Windows are you on?

activities.message: The URL and the request are POST and the ones which i gave you. You can get the pop up by turning the IE XSS filter off and then executing the request
activities.markdown_message: The URL and the request are POST and the ones which i gave you. You can get the pop up by turning the IE XSS filter off and then executing the request

activities.message:
Hi ht_shahmeer,

Thanks for providing us with more info. We turned off the IE XSS filter by going to Tools - Internet Options - Security tab - Custom level - Scripting - Disable XSS Filter. Then we went to the URL https://moneystream.com/blog/?s=Search%2bthis%2bwebsite%252671879%3balert(1)%2f%2f593 on IE 9 but still couldn't see the alert dialog popped up. Could you provide us a video or screenshots to help give us the exact steps to reproduce this? Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi ht_shahmeer,

Thanks for providing us with more info. We turned off the IE XSS filter by going to Tools - Internet Options - Security tab - Custom level - Scripting - Disable XSS Filter. Then we went to the URL https://moneystream.com/blog/?s=Search%2bthis%2bwebsite%252671879%3balert(1)%2f%2f593 on IE 9 but still couldn't see the alert dialog popped up. Could you provide us a video or screenshots to help give us the exact steps to reproduce this? Thanks!

activities.message:
Hey there @sharonsun. 
I reported this issue about 4 months ago and then the payload was working like a charm that is why i reported this to you. I do not know why i cannot execute this again. I believe some filters have been implemented there. I was observing that the alert(9) statement was being reflected in the script tag to execute XSS but now the brackets have been blocked. Do you have any information
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message: We recently did a WordPress upgrade so perhaps that took care of it. I'm closing this issue now if the script cannot be triggered. Thanks again for the report.
